abstract: The commission accused Intel of illegally using its dominance to block customers from buying competitors’ products.
snippet: The commission accused Intel of illegally using its dominance to block customers from buying competitors’ products.
lead_paragraph: The Intel Corporation, the world’s largest maker of computer chips, has agreed to settle its antitrust case with the Federal Trade Commission, the agency said Tuesday.

headline.main: Intel to Settle F.T.C. Antitrust Case
headline.print_headline: Intel to Settle F.T.C. Antitrust Case

abstract: The Intel Corporation, the world’s largest maker of computer chips, has agreed to settle its antitrust case with the Federal Trade Commission, the agency said Tuesday.
snippet: The Intel Corporation, the world’s largest maker of computer chips, has agreed to settle its antitrust case with the Federal Trade Commission, the agency said Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The Intel Corporation, the world’s largest maker of computer chips, has agreed to settle its antitrust case with the Federal Trade Commission, the agency said Tuesday.

headline.main: Intel to Settle F.T.C. Antitrust Case

abstract: The chip maker Intel agreed to change some practices under a settlement with the Federal Trade Commission.
snippet: The chip maker Intel agreed to change some practices under a settlement with the Federal Trade Commission.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Intel agreed to refrain from a host of business practices to settle accusations of anticompetitive behavior in the market for computer processing and graphics chips, under a settlement announced on Wednesday with the Federal Trade Commission.

headline.main: Intel Settles With F.T.C. On Antitrust
headline.print_headline: Intel Settles With F.T.C. On Antitrust

byline.original: By Edward Wyatt and Ashlee Vance

abstract: In 2009, companies spent more than $47 billion on custom marketing — from magazines to Web sites — to attract specific audiences.
snippet: In 2009, companies spent more than $47 billion on custom marketing — from magazines to Web sites — to attract specific audiences.
lead_paragraph: Vice is happy to be known as a hipster media company. From its headquarters in a former warehouse in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, the company oversees magazines covering youth culture in 23 editions distributed in 26 countries, an online television network and a record label.

headline.main: Vice, a Media Company, Shows Big Brands How to Reach the Hip Crowd
headline.print_headline: A Media Company Shows How to Connect With the Hip Crowd
